abstract: Dutch government pledges to cover half of 160 million euros needed to buy two Rembrandt paintings for Amsterdam’s Rijksmuseum; museum will tap private sources to provide other half; democratic parliament leader Alexander Pechtold, who spearheaded effort, says plan was supported by all political parties and should not invoke same outcry that multi-million euro painting purchase in 1998 did.
lead_paragraph: The government will underwrite the purchase of the portraits of Marten Soolmans and his wife-to-be, Oopjen Coppit, from Éric de Rothschild.

headline.main: Rembrandt Portraits May Come Home, for Record Price, With Government Help
headline.print_headline: Netherlands Plans to Bring Home Two Rembrandts at a Record $180 Million

snippet: The government will underwrite the purchase of the portraits of Marten Soolmans and his wife-to-be, Oopjen Coppit, from Éric de Rothschild.
